chargeHist.descr: Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine
Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine

result.execSummary:
The defendant Danial J Carpenter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(<=3g) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(3)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
THE DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS SHALL DEDUCT RESTITUTION AND ALL OTHER COURT OBLIGATIONS AT THE RATE OF 25% OF ALL MONIES RECEIVED WHILE INCARCERATED.
------------------------------------------
*CORRECTION/AMENDMENT 12/28/2016 - Corrected to indicate Defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (CIP) and Substance Abuse Program (SAP).

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay court costs.   If the defendant is discharged from Extended Supervision with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
--------------------------------

Not to possess or consume alcohol. No drugs except as prescribed and in accordance with the prescription. Submit to random UA's. Not to possess methamphetamines precursors. No bars or liquor stores. 
--------------------------------

Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.
--------------------------------

AODA assessment and follow through with recommended education / treatment.  
--------------------------------
Reimburse Walworth County Drug Enforcement in the amount of $150.00 for buy money.

records.addlTxt: of Sentencing Hearing held 8/4/16; Magie Brady, Court Reporter
Temporary Commitment form filed

** Transcript filed 9/1/16**  

9:02 am  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
Daniel A. Necci appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deft Danial J Carpenter in court, in custody with Atty Michael Fitzsimmons.  Also present on behalf of the defendant is his Mother, Beverly Mohr and former employer, Michael Sieke.  
Matter is before the Court for sentencing.   
Court recites charges.  Court has reviewed PSI.  
Atty Fitzsimmons has reviewed the PSI with his client and has a couple of additions to the PSI and makes a record.  
There are no specific victims to be notified in this case.  
9:04 am  Deputy Cory Newmann is sworn and testifies on exam of Atty Necci.  9:13 am  Cross exam by Atty Fitzsimmons.  9:15 am  Redirect by Atty Necci.  9:16 am  Witness excused.  
9:17 am  Argument as to sentence by Atty Necci.  
9:30 am  Statement by Beverly Mohr, defendant's mother.  
9:40 am  Argument as to sentence by Atty Fitzsimmons.  
9:45 am  Statement by Defendant.  
9:50 am  Court has been provided with a copy of the JOC's for the deft's referred to by the State in their argument.  Court proceeds with making its record and sentencing the defendant.  

Ct #1: Total length of sentence is Eight (8) yrs  
Five (5) yrs IC followed by Three (3) years ES  
332 days of sentence credit on Ct. #1  
Ct #5:  Total length of sentence is Four (4) yrs  
Two (2) yrs IC followed by Two (2) yrs ES, consec to Ct 1  
ELIGIBLE for BOTH CIP AND SAP  

CONDITIONS OF ES:  
1)  Psychological evaluation as determined necessary.  
2)  AODA assessment and follow through with recommended education / treatment.  
3)  Pay court costs and DOC supervision fees.  Costs to include reimbursement for buy money to the Walworth County Drug Enforcement Agency in the amount of $150.00.  
4)  Not to possess or consume alcohol.  No drugs except as prescribed and in accordance with the prescription.  Submit to random UA's.  Not to possess methamphetamines precursors.  
5)  No bars or liquor stores.  
6)  Gain and maintain employment.  
7)  Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.  
10:11 am  Court gives warnings to deft regarding voter ineligibility & firearm possession.  Court in recess.
Original Writ filed with the court. - No longer needed for court.
Order for Defendant's Appearance at Department of Corrections for Pre-Sentence Investigation Report

MUST POST $5000.00 CASH
Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH CI 1138 IF KNOWN TO DEFENDANT.   Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any co-actor(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  CO-ACTOR(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH JENNIFER VOLP, KELLY LEBOW OR ALEXANDRIA KIETZMAN.
